turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about TAAG Angola Airlines.
turn.1: What was the TAAG Angola Airlines's biggest accident?
turn.2: On 31 January 1995, a Boeing 727-200, registration D2-TJB, crashed on landing at Huambo; the landing gear was torn off following the aircraft aquaplaning off the pavement as a result of a long landing.
turn.4: There were no serious injuries among the occupants of the aircraft.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: TAAG bought a Boeing 747-300 Combi from Singapore Airlines in 1997.
turn.7: Did they have any other aircrafts?
turn.8: In , TAAG Angola Airlines informed that it firmed up an order for three Boeing 777-200ERs and four Boeing 737-700s , it also took options on one and two more of these aircraft, respectively.
turn.10: The firm-ordered aircraft were initially scheduled for delivery in .
turn.12: The new aircraft were aimed at replacing the ageing Boeing 747-300s and Boeing 737-200s.
